abstract.p: Felicia D Stoler letter comments on August 28 letter on major causes of increase in diabetes among Americans

block.p: An Aug. 28 letter points to low-fat diets and carbohydrates as a major cause of the increase in diabetes among Americans. In fact, the increases in food-portion sizes, saturated-fat intake and inactivity are the greatest contributing factors to the rise in diabetes and obesity.

An Aug. 28 letter points to low-fat diets and carbohydrates as a major cause of the increase in diabetes among Americans. In fact, the increases in food-portion sizes, saturated-fat intake and inactivity are the greatest contributing factors to the rise in diabetes and obesity.

A large part of the problem is that weight loss is not recognized by the insurance companies as preventive medicine (for diabetes, cardiovascular disease and hypertension). The insurance industry refuses to provide individuals or dietitians with any respectable reimbursement.

Insurance companies should also provide compensation to people who join gyms and even for the supervision of exercising with a certified personal trainer. Access to these services should not be considered a luxury.
FELICIA D. STOLER Morganville, N.J., Aug. 29, 2000
The writer is a nutritionist and exercise physiologist.
